participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

subjectkey.Description: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject

src_subject_id.Description: Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project

interview_date.Description: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

interview_age.Description: Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging. | Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

sex.Description: Sex of subject at birth | M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

caff_intake_1.Description: Typically, how many drinks of the following beverages did you have per week in the past 6 months? Coffee (instant, brewed) coffee, with caffeine, including flavored types | Enter as DECIMAL. Typical serving size - 1 Cup (8 oz)// Interviewer: determine typical average number of standard caffeine (use typical serving)drinks per week in the past six months. If they drink less than weekly, then input the fraction representing weekly use. For example, if someone has 2 coffees a month the math would be 2/4 because there are 4 weeks in one month, the answer is 0.5 per week- so enter "0.5". If they had 1 coffee per month it would be 1/4="0.25. If someone only had 1 coffee in past 6 months it would be 1/24 because there are 24 weeks in 6 months= the answer is ".04"; this is the smallest possible answer.

su_tlfb_alc_lt_calc.Description:
How many STANDARD DRINKS of ALCOHOL such as beer, wine, or liquor (rum, vodka, gin, whiskey) have you had in your life? (# of standard drinks)

If either  "Have you heard of "alcohol ...?" or "Have you had a sip ...?" or "Have you used alcohol is not endorsed ," values for  "tlfb_alc_lt" will be missing.  Here, these missing values have been replaced with "0." | (# of standard drinks)
